Package java_source_code_management_tool.controller

Class JavaSourceFileController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java_source_code_management_tool.controller.JavaSourceFileController
  • public class JavaSourceFileController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists of controller methods related to actions on Java source files that follow the Model-View-Controller pattern.
    Author:
    Jordan and Yanis (Group 4 - Pair 10)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      JavaSourceFileController​(JavaSourceFileService javaSourceFileService, UserService userService)
      Constructs a new Java source file controller with the specified Java source file service and user service.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addVersionActionPerformed​(java.lang.String versionNumber, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> strDescriptions)
      Tells the model to add a new version to the currently opened Java source file.
      void openDbJavaSourceFileAndDisplayContentActionPerformed​(java.lang.String selectedPathFs)
      Tells the model to load from the database the Java source file that has the specified file system path.
      void openFsJavaSourceFileAndDisplayContentActionPerformed()
      Tells the view to show a file dialog from which the user can select a file on its file system.
      void openFsJavaSourceFileAndManageVersionsActionPerformed()
      Tells the view to show a file dialog from which the user can select a file on its file system.
      void setView​(MainFrame mainFrame)
      Sets the view to use.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • JavaSourceFileController

        public JavaSourceFileController​(JavaSourceFileService javaSourceFileService,
                                UserService userService)
        Constructs a new Java source file controller with the specified Java source file service and user service.
        Parameters:
        javaSourceFileService - the Java source file service acting as a model.
        userService - the user service acting as a model.

    • Method Detail

      • setView

        public void setView​(MainFrame mainFrame)
        Sets the view to use.
        Parameters:
        mainFrame - the view to use.

      • openFsJavaSourceFileAndManageVersionsActionPerformed

        public void openFsJavaSourceFileAndManageVersionsActionPerformed()
        Tells the view to show a file dialog from which the user can select a file on its file system. If a file is selected, tells the model to load it, and the view to display its version related data in the file version management panel.

      • openFsJavaSourceFileAndDisplayContentActionPerformed

        public void openFsJavaSourceFileAndDisplayContentActionPerformed()
        Tells the view to show a file dialog from which the user can select a file on its file system. If a file is selected, tells the model to load it, and the view to display its content in the Java source file viewer panel.

      • openDbJavaSourceFileAndDisplayContentActionPerformed

        public void openDbJavaSourceFileAndDisplayContentActionPerformed​(java.lang.String selectedPathFs)
        Tells the model to load from the database the Java source file that has the specified file system path. When the file has been loaded, tells the view to display its content in the Java source file viewer panel.
        Parameters:
        selectedPathFs - the file system path of the Java source file to load from the database.

      • addVersionActionPerformed

        public void addVersionActionPerformed​(java.lang.String versionNumber,
                                      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> strDescriptions)
        Tells the model to add a new version to the currently opened Java source file. The specified version number and its list of related descriptions are first checked before being saved.
        Parameters:
        versionNumber - the version number to add.
        strDescriptions - the list of descriptions of the new version to add.
